title: Orange County Register Readers Vote Saddleback Memorial and Orange Coast Memorial Medical Centers the Region's Best Hospitals
text:
MemorialCare Health System
MemorialCare Hospitals Again Take Top Spots in Annual Reader Survey
ORANGE COUNTY, Calif. , Oct. 8, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- Saddleback Memorial Medical Center and Orange Coast Memorial Medical again took top spots in the Best Hospital Category in the Orange County Register " Best of Orange County " competition that annually asks its readership to vote for their favorite products, services and places in Orange County . Both are part of MemorialCare Health System, a Southern California integrated delivery system that is a national leader, pioneer and innovator in best-practice, evidence-based medicine.
Saddleback Memorial and Orange Coast Memorial ranked the top two Best Hospitals-the second year Saddleback Memorial ranked first while Orange Coast Memorial moved from third to second place. The results of the top three vote-getters in each category are published in the Orange County Register's annual Best of Orange County magazine.
"We are proud of this tremendous achievement by our extraordinary physicians, nurses and other clinicians, support staff, volunteers and donors at Saddleback Memorial and Orange Coast Memorial," says Barry Arbuckle , PhD, President & CEO of the nonprofit MemorialCare Health System with more than 200 care locations throughout the Southland. In addition to Saddleback Memorial and Orange Coast Memorial, MemorialCare includes Long Beach Memorial, Miller Children's & Women's Hospital Long Beach , Community Hospital Long Beach , MemorialCare Medical Group , Greater Newport Physicians, Seaside Health Plan , ambulatory surgery centers, imaging facilities and urgent care centers.
"To be recognized by the community again as Orange County's Best Hospital is a tribute to our tremendous staff who works tirelessly to ensure our patients continually receive exceptional, compassionate quality care and superior clinical outcomes," says Steve Geidt , CEO of Saddleback Memorial Medical Center. "We're extremely proud of our team and thank the Orange County community for recognizing our accomplishments and voting for us for a second consecutive year."
"We are honored to have been voted among the Best Hospitals for the second consecutive year," said Marcia Manker , CEO of Orange Coast Memorial Medical Center. "Every day, we work together as family to set a new standard of excellence for the delivery of compassionate and innovative health care to our local communities. Without our talented and selfless physicians, nurses, employees, volunteers and donors, this recognition would not be possible."
Saddleback Memorial is continually honored for exceptional medical expertise that offers high quality, compassionate care for patients and families at every stage of their lives. It received Healthgrades 2015 America's 50 Best Hospitals, presented to only 1% of U.S. hospitals for consistent, sustained clinical performance, high quality care and superior patient outcomes for at least six years. It also received Becker's Healthcare Top U.S. Hospitals and American Heart Association Get with the Guidelines highest honor-Gold Plus for cardiac and stroke care. Its centers of excellence are renowned for prevention, diagnosis and treatment of cancer, heart disease, stroke, pulmonary disease, orthopedics and diabetes; and for leadership in emergency medicine, critical care medicine, breast health, outpatient rehabilitation, advanced imaging, women's health, geriatric care and surgery, including robotic-assisted procedures. The Women's Hospital at Saddleback Memorial Laguna Hills includes personalized obstetrics care, a highly regarded perinatal program and Level III neonatal intensive care unit that specialize in high-risk pregnancies and caring for fragile newborns.
Orange Coast Memorial Medical Center, the only nonprofit hospital in the area, has been recognized for dedication to patient safety as a "Straight A's" hospital, never receiving a grade lower than an A from the semi-annual Hospital Safety Score since the Score first launched in 2012. It is one of only 182 hospitals in the entire country to receive this recognition, which rates how well hospitals protect patients from preventable medical errors, injuries and infections. It has also been voted "Best Place to Work" and a "Top Workplace" multiple times in recent years by readers of the Orange County Register and OC Metro Magazine. It provides convenient access to comprehensive health care services at its specialty centers for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of cancer, heart and vascular disease, obesity, orthopedics, digestive disease, movement disorders and Parkinson's disease as well as advanced imaging, childbirth services and outpatient rehabilitation and physical therapy.
